intro: Taraxacum acromaurum, commonly known as the purple ray floret dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers that transition to a purple or reddish color in the fruiting stage. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and have a waxy coating. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Taraxacum acromaurum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
